content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of 13 building blocks organized in multiple layers:
- Base layer: 3 red arched blocks
- Middle/top layers: Various blocks including yellow cylinders, green rectangles, yellow tall rectangles, blue cube, and orange triangular roof

## Spatial Relationships
The structure appears to be a toy train with a small house:
- Left section (train): Two tall yellow smokestacks with green blocks behind them, red arched blocks as the base, and yellow cylindrical blocks on top
- Right section (house): Blue cube with orange triangular roof, sitting on a green rectangular block, which sits on a red arched block

# Required Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, the following blocks are needed:
- Block #1: Red arched block (2 needed)
- Block #2: Red arched block (1 needed)
- Block #3: Blue cube (1 needed)
- Block #6: Green horizontal rectangular block (1 needed)
- Block #7: Green vertical rectangular block (2 needed)
- Block #11: Yellow vertical tall rectangular block (2 needed)
- Block #12: Yellow cylindrical/semicircular block (3 needed)
- Block #15: Orange triangular roof (1 needed)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 1
    Step4: Move block with index 6
    Step5: Move block with index 7
    Step6: Move block with index 7
    Step7: Move block with index 11
    Step8: Move block with index 11
    Step9: Move block with index 12
    Step10: Move block with index 12
    Step11: Move block with index 12
    Step12: Move block with index 3
    Step13: Move block with index 15
}
```

This assembly sequence builds the structure from the ground up, starting with the red arched blocks as the foundation, adding the green and yellow blocks for the train section, and finishing with the house section on the right.
